text: hi everyone SLM here today I will be
making a dish that is loved by the
children and teenagers in Vietnam it's
called Louisa wall Lois is the
Vietnamese word for macaroni sounding to
stir-fry and ball means beef so it's
basically stir-fry pasta or macaroni
with beef is a Vietnamese take on a
Western dish so you will see and taste
two words on one plate the Western pasta
with Vietnamese or Asian seasonings very
interesting so let's begin recipes we
can start by marinating the beef I have
here half a power or a 230 gram beef
thing blade slides against the green to
that I'm going to add a tablespoon of
minced garlic some chicken stock sugar
pepper and a pinch of salt also add a
tablespoon of soy sauce I prefer using
soy sauce for this recipe but you can
actually use fish sauce as well those
are the basic seasonings some extra
tricks to make a very tender and juicy
beef stir fry is to add a tablespoon of
vegetable oil and a teaspoon of
cornstarch or tapioca starch into the
marinade what happens is the starch
gonna form a thin layer outside the beef
slices and keep the juice inside the
beef McKinney's really tender and juicy
for the onion remove the core and cut
into thick slices lettuce then you want
to separate the onion layers
cut a small tomato into wedges and then
cut the wedges in half chopped up the
green part of the spring onion and shred
the white part finely then cook the
macaroni according to the package
instructions with a good teaspoon of
salt give it a good stir so that they
won't stick to each other because we're
gonna stir fry the macaronis later so
you want to cook the pasta
1 minute shorter than instructed in the
package then bring them in a colander
and mix with a teaspoon of vegetable oil
to avoid sticking now in a large pan or
wok heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
and fry the shredded white between onion
until fragrant then toss in the
marinated trees and so fly on tightly
until it's no longer
when the deep has change is color you
want to transfer it back to the
container if you keep the beef in the
pan and continue adding the macaroni the
beef will be overcooked and it would
turn to yummy now we add in some more
oil in the pan and add in the macaronis
stir for a minute and now we're going to
add in our secret ingredient which is
tomato paste but you look Grammer my
color is you need two tablespoons of
tomato paste the tomato paste can I keep
the macaronis moist and give it a really
beautiful great color now you want to
turn the heat to very low or just turn
it off when we add in the seasonings
just season with some chicken stock or
sugar about a teaspoon of oyster sauce
to make the pasta look very shiny in
option order also add about teaspoon of
soy sauce give it a good stir and turn
on the heat again add the onion slices
and stir fry for a minute or two until
it turns quite translucent then add the
tomatoes and the beef as well stir fry
for another minute and we are done
transfer it to a serving plate garnish
with some tomato slices and spring onion
on top serve with a side bolt of chilli
soy sauce you can sell this dish as a
preference or a late-night supper the
pasta should be moist and just a little
bit chewy
the baby's so tender and juicy is so
